column2: MONTANA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
2. You are approaching a railroad crossing and the crossing signals are flashing. You should:
column4: do what the approaching vehicle does.
column6: slow down and look for a train.
column8: look for a train, then speed up.
column10: stop and look for a train.

column2: 3. A speed limit is the __________ speed at which a vehicle may legally travel on the road under ideal conditions.
4. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.
column6: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column8: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column10: Drivers are not required to stop.

column2: 5. A steady yellow light at an intersection means:
column4: Proceed with caution through the intersection
column6: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column8: Immediately come to a complete stop

column2: 6. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 7. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column6: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column10: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 8. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
9. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 10. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column6: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 11. Highway hypnosis is a driving condition that can result from:
column6: staring at the roadway for long periods of time.

column2: 12. Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
13. If you arrive at an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as another vehicle:
column4: the car on the right should yield to the car on the left.
column6: the car on the left should yield to the car on the right.
column8: any vehicle already in the intersection should yield to the car on the right.
column10: the car on the left has the right-of-way.

column2: 14. This road sign indicates that:
column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column8: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 15. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.
column6: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.

column2: 16. This sign means drivers must not pass other vehicles:
column4: unless it is safe to do so.

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 18. At dawn you should:
column4: drive with your emergency flashers on.
column6: avoid turning your vehicle lights on.
column10: drive with your parking lights on.

column2: 19. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column10: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 20. Which shape is a warning sign?
21. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
22. Which shape is a stop sign?
23. This sign warns drivers of:
24. If you see an animal on the road:
column4: pass the animal as fast as possible.

column2: 25. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column10: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.

column2: 26. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
27. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
28. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column8: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 29. When approaching the scene of a crash, you should:
column8: if you are involved in the crash, do not drive away and help secure medical aid for the injured.

column2: 30. Your ability to drive safely can be impaired by:
column6: drugs, even if they are over-the-counter.

column2: 31. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: stop and wait for the light to change.
column10: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.

column2: 32. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 33. Which shape is a yield sign?
31. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: stop and wait for the light to change.
column10: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.

column2: 32. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column8: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
